Articles.Content: So, for the first time since 1.1 i am using a science lab. So, i placed it on orbit of the mun, landed, collected science, returned to the lab and processed. After that the experiments (review stored data) disappear. Was that intended? I mean, on the notes for 1.1 it is said that data could no longer be duplicated, was that the meaning? I mean, if i process the data all the science i ll get from it will be from the processing itself and i ll no longer be able to send or recover it after returning to kerbin. Is that right?
Yes, that was an intentional change to the way labs work. It was meant to prevent you from taking the same science result to several labs and getting unlimited science.
But, will that make the experiment re-runnable for 100% science? I mean, since i never transmited or recovered i believe the game i ll never credit it as a done experiment. right?
Yes, if you take a second copy of the experiment back to KSC you get full science credit for it.
